intro: Theligonum cynocrambe var. saxatilis, commonly known as the saxatile ligonum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces fragrant, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its adaptability to rocky and well-drained soils makes it a hardy species found in alpine and arid environments. The plant's botanical features reflect its evolutionary adaptation to harsh, high-altitude conditions.
